intro: Enkianthus meisteria, commonly known as the Meister's enkianthus, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters, with dark green, oval leaves that turn yellow in autumn. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and prefers partial shade to full sun. The flowers bloom in late spring, adding ornamental value to gardens and natural landscapes.
